oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RUN-UP OF TSUNAMIS BY LINEAR AND NONLINEAR THEORIES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Goto, Chiaki
Shuto, Nobuo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: run up
tsunami
nonlinear theory
linear theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Linear and nonlinear sets of equations of long waves in the Lagrangian description are solved numerically to obtain run-up heights. Numerical results are compared -with theoretical ones in case of simple topographies and the agreement is quite satisfactory. As a practical application, the computation is carried out for the Okkirai Bay in Japan. The computed run-up neighs agree fairly well with the recorded ones.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 17 (1980): Proceedings of 17th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Sydney, Australia, 1980.; 42
